question: Which of the following agricultural holdings have a largest percentage in India?
explanation: As much as 67 percent of India\'s farmland is held by the marginal farmers. It is observed that at the national level maximum marginal farms reside in Uttar Pradesh in 2010-11. Out of a total of 138.35 million of holdings, Uttar Pradesh accounts for a highest number of holdings (23.33 million) followed by Bihar (16.19 million) in 2010-11.
